alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 11 at 7:52PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Crawford and Erie. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 751 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Meadville, Corry, Titusville, Union City, Cambridge Springs, Linesville, Guys Mills, Lincolnville, Canadohta Lake, Riceville, Harmonsburg, Atlantic, Adamsville, Pymatuning North, Pymatuning Central, Cochranton, Saegertown, Conneaut Lake, Hydetown and Mill Village. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
